title: String length restriction byepass at https://callerfeel.mtnonline.com/profile/feedback.html
content:
Summary:
Hi, hope you are well :)
I found that the attacker can bye pass the lenght restriction of user name at the feedback form
Steps To Reproduce:
Impact
Attacker can make the receiver page to delay and can cause application level dos
Mitigation:
Restrict the lenght of the string in backend too not only front end
Best regards
@aliyugombe
steps: Navigate to the feedback form at https://callerfeel.mtnonline.com/profile/feedback.html
Enter a username that exceeds the front-end length restriction by manipulating the input (e.g., via browser dev tools or direct API call)
vuln_description: The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the front-end length restriction for the username field in the feedback form, potentially causing application-level denial of service (DoS) by submitting excessively long strings that delay or crash the receiver page.
reason: The vulnerability involves a simple bypass of front-end validation without any complex interactions or state manipulations. The attack is straightforward and does not require understanding of multiple components or novel logic.
